vs ğ“Ÿ All Allah Ali


This artefact from the Danube Boian culture 4300â€“3500 BC might seem boring to the modern eye. But such a geometric symbolic object was a novelty appearing in a world which was still dominated by hunter gatherers and neolithic farmers. The ğ“Š¹ symbol on it could easily be rejected as coincidence if it wasn't for the trace of the unbeloved swastika symbol, which also spread from the Danube to Sumer, Indus and beyond.

Although Egypt is renowned to be polytheistic, we often find text which just reference "the God". Other times we find collections of praises such as ğ“Ÿğ“‚‹ğ“ğ“œ â€œAll Wissenderâ€, â€œAll Rechterâ€, â€œAll Reckonerâ€, â€œAll Xanderâ€...
